<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 178, 292]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 276, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9702/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 390, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 AS Level Structured Questions  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[752, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 560]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 220, 603]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 729, 636]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 60.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 73, 124, 88]]<|/det|>
## Data  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 103, 670, 560]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space \(c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) permeability of free space \(\mu_{0} = 4\pi \times 10^{- 7}\mathrm{Hm}^{- 1}\) permittivity of free space \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{- 12}\mathrm{Fm}^{- 1}\) \((\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{- 1})\) elementary charge \(e = 1.60\times 10^{- 19}\mathrm{C}\) the Planck constant \(h = 6.63\times 10^{- 34}\mathrm{Js}\) unified atomic mass unit \(1u = 1.66\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of electron \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{- 31}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of proton \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) molar gas constant \(R = 8.31\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Avogadro constant \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Boltzmann constant \(k = 1.38\times 10^{- 23}\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant \(G = 6.67\times 10^{- 11}\mathrm{Nm}^{2}\mathrm{kg}^{- 2}\) acceleration of free fall \(g = 9.81\mathrm{m s}^{- 2}\)

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 168, 88]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 106, 556, 139]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 158, 520, 173]]<|/det|>
\[W = p\Delta V\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 184, 532, 214]]<|/det|>
\[\phi = -\frac{Gm}{r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 225, 515, 241]]<|/det|>
\[p = \rho gh\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 250, 559, 280]]<|/det|>
\[p = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V}\langle c^2\rangle\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 291, 534, 307]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\omega^2 x\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 325, 603, 358]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \nu_0\cos \omega t\] \[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{(\chi_0^2 - \chi^2)}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 365, 532, 399]]<|/det|>
\[f_0 = \frac{f_s\nu}{v\pm\nu_s}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 408, 536, 440]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_0r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 448, 623, 466]]<|/det|>
\[1 / C = 1 / C_1 + 1 / C_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 481, 591, 500]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_1 + C_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 512, 527, 539]]<|/det|>
\[W = \frac{1}{2} QV\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 551, 527, 570]]<|/det|>
\[I = A n v q\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 585, 591, 603]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_{1} + R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 617, 623, 635]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_{1} + 1 / R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 643, 527, 675]]<|/det|>
\[V_{\mathrm{H}} = \frac{BI}{ntq}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 686, 556, 703]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\sin \omega t\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 718, 573, 737]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\exp (-\lambda t)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 742, 532, 777]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_{\frac{1}{2}}}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[295, 71, 700, 89]]<|/det|>
Answer **all** the questions in the spaces provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 99, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 148, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 285, 121]]<|/det|>
Define _velocity_.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[858, 163, 920, 181]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 195, 146, 214]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 195, 920, 229]]<|/det|>
The drag force \(F_{\mathrm{D}}\) acting on a car moving with speed \(v\) along a straight horizontal road is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[453, 240, 544, 260]]<|/det|>
\[F_{\mathrm{D}} = \nu^2 A k\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 272, 693, 291]]<|/det|>
where \(k\) is a constant and \(A\) is the cross-sectional area of the car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 304, 430, 322]]<|/det|>
Determine the SI base units of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[470, 488, 920, 507]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 520, 144, 537]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 520, 920, 553]]<|/det|>
The value of \(k\), in SI base units, for the car in **(b)** is 0.24. The cross-sectional area \(A\) of the car is \(5.1 \text{m}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 566, 920, 615]]<|/det|>
The car is travelling with a constant speed along a straight road and the output power of the engine is \(4.8 \times 10^4 \text{W}\). Assume that the output power of the engine is equal to the rate at which the drag force \(F_{\mathrm{D}}\) is doing work against the car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 628, 418, 644]]<|/det|>
Determine the speed of the car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[512, 810, 920, 828]]<|/det|>
<form>speed = .................................................... $\text{ms}^{-1}$

<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 842, 920, 860]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Total: 6]

<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 528, 920, 577]]<|/det|>
A ball is kicked with a velocity of \(15 \text{ m s}^{-1}\) at an angle of \(60^{\circ}\) to horizontal ground. The ball then strikes a vertical wall at the instant when the path of the ball becomes horizontal, as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[240, 588, 767, 728]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 747, 591, 765]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.2 (not to scale)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 778, 484, 796]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 183, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 71, 918, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[528, 255, 920, 273]]<|/det|>
<form>time = .................................................... s [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 286, 181, 305]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 285, 920, 319]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 336, 920, 355]]<|/det|>
<form>................................................................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 365, 920, 383]]<|/det|>
<form>................................................................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 395, 181, 413]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 394, 779, 413]]<|/det|>
Show that the ball strikes the wall with a horizontal velocity of \(7.5 \text{m s}^{- 1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 495, 920, 514]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 526, 144, 545]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 526, 920, 559]]<|/det|>
The mass of the ball in **(b)** is \(0.40\mathrm{kg}\). It is in contact with the wall for a time of \(0.12\mathrm{s}\) and rebounds horizontally with a speed of \(4.3\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 572, 181, 591]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 572, 920, 605]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 720, 920, 739]]<|/det|>
<form>change in momentum = ........................................... \(\mathsf{kgm s}^{- 1}\) [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 752, 181, 771]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 752, 823, 771]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 852, 920, 870]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 920, 230]]<|/det|>
A ball of mass \(0.42\mathrm{kg}\) is dropped from the top of a building. The ball falls from rest through a vertical distance of \(78\mathrm{m}\) to the ground. Air resistance is significant so that the ball reaches constant (terminal) velocity before hitting the ground. The ball hits the ground with a speed of \(23\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 242, 183, 260]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 241, 771, 260]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 273, 223, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>1.</label>

the decrease in gravitational potential energy

decrease in gravitational potential energy = .................................................... J [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
The ball in **(b)** is dropped at time \(t = 0\) and hits the ground at time \(t = T\). The acceleration of free fall is \(g\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 117, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
